reviewText: Where can i start with Pat and Mat the video game. Have you ever played the perfect game? Have you ever tasted food so good you went into a coma for 2 weeks? Have you ever felt a love worth more than life it self? This is what Pat & Mat symbolizes to me, it is the very peak of human ingenuity. I have played many games in my time but none have touched me like Pat & Mat, The story is simple yet elegant There are no cut scenes and the story is shown simply through Pat & mat's interactions and how they deal with the struggles we all face in everyday life. In doing this they show us we are not alone in the world, they show us that life is about more than the money you earn and the things you own, they show us what it means to be human.\n\nThis is more than a video game, it's a way of life... This is Pat & Mat

reviewText: Experience Pat & Mat, the heartbreaking tale of two homosexual deviants trying to hide their forbidden love from the opressive 1980's Czechoslovakian regime.  After leaving their window open during a night of passionate love, Pat and Mat must flee from the authorities, lest they be lynched and made an example of. You guide the two lovers, either in singleplayer or Co-operative as you battle police and bigoted countryman in a two-man war. Will you fight through the endless waves of enemies and escape to America? Or will this story have a tragic ending?

reviewText: 14 years after third impact, Pat awakens to a world he does not remember. He hasn't aged. Much of Earth is laid in ruins,  their car has been dismantled, and people who he once protected have turned against him. Befriending the enigmatic Mat, Pat continues the fight against the angels and realizes the fighting is far from over, even when it could be against his former allies. The characters' struggles continue amidst the battles against the angels and each other, spiraling down to what could inevitably be the end of the world.

reviewText:
After playing Pat & Mat the puzzle adventure game, I can safely say this game is nothing short of the best game ever created. You follow the path of these brothers of war, retiring to country life as they regain sanity after the bloodshed of the battles. Pat, a crippled captain kicked out of the army for desertion, and Mat, an infantry soldier who respected Pat very much. You trail through their adventures fixing cars and playing golf on top of floating barges.
The gameplay is flawless. There can be nothing said wrong about the game whatsoever.

Gameplay 10/10
Story 10/10
Characterization 10/10
Everything 10/10
Pat 10/10
Mat 10/10

reviewText:
After playing Pat and Mat for as little as half an hour, I found myself able to appreciate the lesser things in life. The things we usually take for granted. Our protagonists 'Pat & Mat' live a rather simplistic existence as handymen in an unnamed Czechoslovakian city (easily mistaken, by the uninformed, for a rustic hamlet) where life plods along at a snails pace. Indeed, the setting is incredibly tranquil and as one might imagine, this placidity is reflected in both Pat & Mat's temperament. To say that the duo are relaxed in any way, would be a massive understatement, yet they are no strangers to a little bit of hard work. Even their simple life style comes with the odd challenge (ones that some players may not appreciate, due to their urban locale) yet they never falter in the face of in surmountable odds and always pull through in the end, even if their schemes are ill thought out at the best of times. Whether they player can appreciate their twisted logic will determine how much they get out of the game.

Indeed, even when it comes to something as simple, as say, the construction of a mini golf course, their own unique ingenuity shines through, who else would thing to cover a course in sand after all? Let alone the construction of several courses over a sizeable body of water, whilst neglecting either any standing area for the player or mounting platforms to make reaching aformentioned courses possible.

How they managed to construct these, despite professing to be mere handymen, is beyond my knowledge (presumably they are lying to me, after all, Pat (or perhaps Mat?) claimed to have taken 17 hours to finish a single course, when really, it was possible to do so after only three, perhaps they merely did not wish to hurt my pride? I would not put it past them, the cheeky scamps) but regardless, it is presumably for that same reason that they later found themselves short of supplies to construct the remaining courses.

The knowledge of this left me a little hurt, as I had expected a little more, especially since mini golf was one of only four games on the main menu and in total only had a play time of roughly ten hours. For 39p, I could hardly complain. I will privately shake a first in the twins direction but nothing more, they are not deserving of my ire, not today.

In short, if you are wondering, is this game for me? Then ask yourself how much you enjoy taxing puzzles. If you are a self professed puzzle fanatic (like myself) and felt a little bit let down by the linearity of the new Thief game, then look no further, this is the challenge you have been waiting for, though the overarching plot is nowhere near as forboding, the characters still retain a certain amount of charm that will invariably win you over, with time, should you allow them into your heart. All I can say, is to be patient with this one; invest yourself in its charming narrative and with time, you will surely reap what ye sow.

reviewText:
Pat& Mat is a very short little game, based on the stop-motion kids series with the same name.
You are able to play one scenario where you have to find a way to start a car, a golf scenario, a find-the-difference scenario and a puzzle.
All are done with a lot of love for detail regarding the series, some scenarios are quite challenging. But overall I'd say this game won't keep you busy for long I played all modes ( although I didn't finish the golf scenario) in 3 hours. So that's that.
The musical score is the original from the series and matches the game perfectly.
Graphically it's no masterpiece but a piece of solid work, with a lot of attention for detail.
I bought this game for 0,99 $ when it was on sale for the Xmas Sale on Steam. That price was waaaay okay and absolutely justified for the fun I had. And I would definitely recommend it for casual gamers.

reviewText: Pat & Mat can be described simply as a masterpiece. The story is about a man with dual personality issues, one of them, Pat, is a friendly godfearing christian. We must help Pat uncover why his split personality is so evil, while we help Mat cover up his horrible crimes.\nI believe this game can only get one rating, and that is a rock solid 10/10.

reviewText: It's got a nice variety of simple games.  The controls are a bit clunky in some cases, and the memory game can be unforgiving before it recognizes that you've got a match (and it's a large bit of luck to what they where and where in the scrolling list of things possible their items actually are, which is annoying, since the times are that close).  Not complicated or deep, but something to do to veg a bit.\n\nThe sound effects can be a bit annoying, and not being able to skip menus when redoing a level to try to get a better rank can get obnoxious.

reviewText:
6min of this game - shows all 4 mini games
https://youtu.be/jX1KYXHnc58

cute for a kid but out of the 4 mini games the mini gulf is the best one.
the 4 mini game are:
1) point & click. you click things to get pat&mat to work together picking up and using stuff to repair the car's wheel. its the same every time.
2) puzzle mode: most of the screen is a picture (some are moving) and your given pieces up top to put in the picture to complete the puzzle in a give time limit.
3) fashion show/memory: Pat or Mat will wear some items and your expected to remember and pick them out within the time given.
4) mini gulf: by far the best part. you click a ball and pull back to launch it forward over obstacle to get it into a hole.
this game also has a build feature so you can make your own gulf course to play.

reviewText: Pat & Mat is a fairly straightforward puzzle game that has adequate cartoonish graphics and a slightly irritating clownish soundtrack.  Despite this minor shortcoming though, Pat & Mat does work well with the Steam Overlay and widescreen resolutions and also features controller support (although I could not get the game to recognize mine).  There are a variety of puzzle modes, including standard jigsaw, but what really stands out here is the inclusion of multiplayer.  Not too many puzzle games offer this option, so for that feature alone it is worth giving Pat   & Mat a try.  The gameplay will probably not have mainstream appeal, but is ideal for children in the 7-10 age group as well as casual gamers looking for a small diversion.

reviewText:
I was seriously disapointed with this game since theres only ONE, one puzzle to be solved and then jigsaw, stupid memory game and minigolf.

The puzzle was simple and way too short, but still enjoyable. I liked the mechanics and the way some actions reguired to use both Pat and Mat was pretty need. But all this just ads to the disapointment, feels like wasted potential. Obiviously devs knew what they were doing. The graphics were in my opinion very good and the art style was perfect for the game. Looked pretty much just like the show and it did gave me the nostalgic feels. The soundtrack as well was spot on, fitted perfectly. I mean this game was so close to being the best point & click game of the year. Just one problem, ONLY ONE PUZZLE. Im sorry for being so repetive but Im just in awe of disapointment. Atleast I learned not to trust anything game related that comes from old soviet countries, looking at you Stalker, another game that was so close to being amazing.

Dont buy, plunder of the century

reviewText:
Pat and Mat was the childhood cartoon for me.
I loved every single moment of it.
This game was a sad way to steal people of their money.
No amount of nostalgia can change the fact that even at a sale, in price of 0.99 I would not recommend buying the game.
All that you have here is one episode where the car tire is punctured and you have to fix it.
The episode is surprisingly easy and void of any humor.
I finished the episode in less than 10 minutes.
There are mini games but I do not care for mini games.
So that is it.
10 minutes if you are the slowest person on earth.
Really simple and bland.
Sure the game works, although you have to downgrade your physX first and I did not come across any bugs in the 5 minutes of Gameplay I received but no way I can recommend this.

If you really want pat and mat go on the net and watch the series, much better spent time.

reviewText:
In this game you play as Pat and Mat. Two best friends who live together in the middle of nowhere.

The game has an underlying story though. One of the friends is insane and has created the other friend in order to cope with the fact that he is terrified of being alone. This proves their reasoning for living with nothing around them. He creates the problems such as a popped tyre himself and solves the problem himself yet he thinks he sees the other doing it. The real kicker is you don't know who is the insane one and so it's up to you to solve the mysterious case of Pat and Mat.

The secrets that are hidden within are more unsettling than The Babadook.

Don't let him in...

reviewText:
This game follows two /or perhaps just one) inmate in a post-Sovjet Russian mental asylum. Patryev and Matovsky, their real names unknown, are completely, 100% clinically insane. Schizofrenic to the brain-stem; they believe that they are in fact handymen in the Czech countryside, helping what is only vague after-images of people they once knew.

That is the story, as far as I know, as anything else goes unmentioned in the game itself.
Now, if that doesn't draw you in, there are three more things I'll take a look on: Gameplay, Audio, and Video. Oxford comma for added effect. And readability.

reviewText:
This game is just amazing! You start off in a menu with amazing music and amazing graphics. You get to choose which out of the 4 gamemode's you want to play. There's a puzzle gamemode which is hard af, it's almost impossible to get gold on ANY level even on the first one. The goal is to complete a puzzle as fast as possible with the least amount of tries. The puzzles all include Pat & Mat which is a really good thing in my opinion because I'm a really big fan of them.

There's also an amazing gamemode where you'd have to complete a minigolf course as fast as possible. This is also very hard but I thought it was easier than the puzzle gamemode. The background music was also really good and relaxing. You can also make your own minigolf course which I haven't done yet because I think it's quite boring to make a course myself.

I haven't played the other 2 gamemodes yet which kind of shows how amazing the other 2 are. One of them is about Pat & Mat working together or something like that. The other one is called a Fashion Show. The point of this gamemode is to remember the things they were wearing or holding.

I'll rate this game 10 out of 10 golfballs. The music made the game enjoyable and the minigames were challenging.
It's totally worth the 5 dollar/euro.

reviewText:
Raquel woke up and got out of bed. She could barely walk and she moved very slowly. She looked outside to see where she was, and to her dismay she was no longer in a Spanish-speaking country. She turned on the television and found out that all the channels were in English, except for Univision. She also saw American flags outside. Raquel was in the United States, but she wasn't living in Los Angeles; she was in a rural area.

Was it all a dream? It must have been, because she didn't speak a word of Spanish. She didn't have any family in Mexico, either. As a matter of fact, she had no immediate family; they were all dead.

She looked in a mirror and noticed that there was a contrast between her real face and what she looked like in her dreams. Raquel was not a young lady, but a geriatric woman rotting away on a farm with her feline companions. She never found love in her real life; Arturo was just the man of her dreams, and she could no longer live without having him by her side. She said, I'd rather burn on Hades' grill than live another minute without my beloved Arturo!" These were her last words before she fell into an eternal sleep due to her overdose on Lortab."

reviewText:
I bought this game on impulse because it was so cheap, but was plesantly surprised.
-The game captures the Pat & Mat atmosphere very well. The music from the show is right where you want it to be.
- the point & click segment is excellent, but sadly quite short.
- the jigsaw puzzle segment is nicely animated and works well, once they've introduce dall the gameplay elements
- the minigolf segment is surprisingly good.
- the animation quality is excellent and faithful to the source material
- the resolution & options are a little obfuscated, but they are excellent once you change them to proper settings. was not expecting x8 AA and x16 anisotropic filtering running on 1080p 60+ fps
- would reccommend to the young 'uns or the nostalgic. (and mini-golf enthusiant?)
